Key Match Events: Giancarlo Stanton's near-grand slam in the eighth inning came just short of tying the game.
Austin Wells had two hits earlier in the game but struck out with two on in the ninth inning to end the game.
The Yankees were placed in a five-run hole early due to a poor outing by Will Warren.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees were sitting atop the AL East and had reinforcements on the way, including Austin Wells and Oswaldo Cabrera.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed pride in the team's resilience and highlighted their position in the standings as pivotal.
The loss was a significant moment in their playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game saw multiple base runners and key defensive plays, including a pitch clock violation that led to a strikeout.
The Cardinals' performance was marked by effective pitching and timely hits.
